requirement: Organizations shall define a Business Continuity strategy for resumption of critical services.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates the development of a Business Continuity strategy to ensure the resumption of critical services during or after a disruption.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive Business Continuity Plan (BCP) that outlines procedures for resuming critical services in the event of a disaster or disruption. The plan should include risk assessments, impact analyses, and recovery strategies for all critical services.

Identify and document all critical services and assets that are essential for the organization's operations. This includes IT systems, infrastructure, personnel, and other resources that are critical to the organization's ability to resume operations.

Conduct regular Business Impact Analyses (BIAs) to identify potential risks and impacts on critical services and assets. This will help the organization to prioritize its recovery efforts and allocate resources effectively.

Develop a communication plan that outlines procedures for communicating with stakeholders, including employees, customers, and suppliers, in the event of a disaster or disruption. This plan should include contact information, notification procedures, and emergency contact details.

Conduct regular business continuity exercises, such as tabletop exercises or simulations, to test the organization's Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and identify areas for improvement. This will help the organization to ensure that its BCP is effective and up-to-date.

controls.control_title: Establish a Business Continuity Management Team
controls.control: Establish a Business Continuity Management team that is responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining the organization's Business Continuity Plan (BCP). This team should include representatives from all departments and functions, including IT, operations, and management.

requirement: Organizations shall identify and define recovery objectives for critical services.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates the identification and definition of recovery objectives for critical services to ensure a full recovery of all services provided by the unit.

controls.control_title: Define Recovery Objectives for Critical Services
controls.control: Establish a process to identify and define recovery objectives for critical services. This includes identifying the maximum tolerable downtime (MTD) and the recovery time objective (RTO) for each critical service. The recovery objectives should be documented and communicated to relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Involve Stakeholders in Recovery Objective Definition
controls.control: Involve relevant stakeholders, including business owners, IT teams, and end-users, in the definition of recovery objectives for critical services. This ensures that the recovery objectives align with business needs and are achievable.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Recovery Objectives Regularly
controls.control: Regularly review and update recovery objectives for critical services to ensure they remain relevant and effective. This includes reviewing changes to business needs, technology, and risk profiles.

Document recovery objectives for critical services in a centralized repository, such as a service catalog or a disaster recovery plan. This ensures that recovery objectives are easily accessible and can be shared with relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Establish Metrics to Measure Recovery Objectives
controls.control: Establish metrics to measure the achievement of recovery objectives for critical services. This includes metrics such as mean time to recover (MTTR), mean time between failures (MTBF), and service level agreements (SLAs).

requirement: Organizations shall conduct a risk assessment to identify potential disruptions and their impact on critical services.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates the conduct of a risk assessment to identify potential disruptions and their impact on critical services, ensuring the development of an effective Business Continuity strategy.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive risk assessment framework that outlines the process for identifying, assessing, and prioritizing potential disruptions to critical services. This framework should include clear guidelines for risk categorization, assessment criteria, and mitigation strategies.

Conduct a thorough inventory of critical services and assets that are essential to the organization's operations. This includes identifying key systems, infrastructure, and personnel that are critical to service delivery.

Schedule regular risk assessments to identify potential disruptions and their impact on critical services. These assessments should be conducted at least annually, or as needed, to ensure that the risk assessment framework remains effective and up-to-date.

Involve relevant stakeholders, including business leaders, IT personnel, and subject matter experts, in the risk assessment process to ensure that all potential disruptions are identified and assessed.

Maintain a record of risk assessment findings, including the results of risk assessments, mitigation strategies, and any changes to the risk assessment framework. This documentation should be accessible to authorized personnel and updated regularly.

Develop and implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks and minimize their impact on critical services. This may include implementing backup systems, developing business continuity plans, and providing training to personnel on risk management procedures.

requirement: Organizations shall define roles and responsibilities for the Business Continuity Management (BCM) team.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates the definition of roles and responsibilities for the BCM team to ensure effective management of Business Continuity activities.

controls.control_title: Define Roles and Responsibilities for BCM Team Lead
controls.control: The organization shall define a clear role and responsibility for the Business Continuity Management (BCM) team lead. This includes identifying the individual responsible for overseeing the BCM program, ensuring compliance with BCM policies and procedures, and coordinating BCM activities across the organization.

controls.control_title: Establish Roles and Responsibilities for BCM Team Members
controls.control: The organization shall define clear roles and responsibilities for each member of the BCM team. This includes identifying the specific tasks and activities each team member is responsible for, as well as their reporting lines and communication channels.

The organization shall maintain a written document that outlines the roles and responsibilities of the BCM team. This document shall be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure it remains accurate and relevant.

controls.control_title: Communicate Roles and Responsibilities to Stakeholders
controls.control: The organization shall communicate the roles and responsibilities of the BCM team to relevant stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners. This shall be done through regular updates, training sessions, and other communication channels.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Roles and Responsibilities Regularly
controls.control: The organization shall regularly review and update the roles and responsibilities of the BCM team to ensure they remain relevant and effective. This shall be done at least annually, or as needed in response to changes in the organization or its BCM program.

controls.control_title: Establish a BCM Team with a Minimum of 36 Members
controls.control: The organization shall establish a Business Continuity Management (BCM) team with a minimum of 36 members, including representatives from all departments and functions. This team shall be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining the organization's business continuity plan.

controls.control_title: Define Roles and Responsibilities within the BCM Team
controls.control: The organization shall define clear roles and responsibilities for each member of the BCM team, including the team lead, departmental representatives, and subject matter experts. This shall ensure that each team member understands their responsibilities and can contribute effectively to the development and implementation of the business continuity plan.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review BCM Team Headcount
controls.control: The organization shall regularly monitor and review the headcount of the BCM team to ensure that it meets the minimum requirement of 36 members. This shall involve conducting regular audits and reviews to identify any gaps or deficiencies in the team's composition.

controls.control_title: Develop a Plan for Maintaining the Minimum BCM Team Headcount
controls.control: The organization shall develop a plan for maintaining the minimum headcount of 36 members in the BCM team, including strategies for recruiting and retaining team members, and for addressing any gaps or deficiencies in the team's composition.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Development Opportunities for BCM Team Members
controls.control: The organization shall provide regular training and development opportunities for BCM team members to ensure that they have the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their roles effectively. This shall include training on business continuity planning, risk management, and crisis management.

Configure the text processing function to handle different types of act titles, names, and introductory statements. This can be achieved by using a dictionary or a database to store the patterns to be removed.
Test the text processing function with sample data to ensure it is working correctly and removing the required information.

controls.control: Regularly review code for any permissions, allowances, or discretionary language. This includes checking for any direct or indirect references to sensitive data or system resources. Use static code analysis tools to identify potential issues and address them promptly.
Implement Access Control Lists (ACLs) to restrict access to sensitive data and system resources. Ensure that ACLs are properly configured and regularly reviewed to prevent unauthorized access.

Implement the least privilege principle to ensure that users and applications only have the necessary permissions and access to perform their tasks. This includes using role-based access control and minimizing the use of privileged accounts.

controls.control: Assign users to roles and restrict access to resources based on their role. This ensures that users only have access to the resources they need to perform their job functions.
Implement strong authentication and authorization mechanisms, such as multi-factor authentication, to ensure that only authorized users can access the system.

controls.control: Regularly review and update access controls to ensure they remain effective and aligned with changing business needs. This helps to prevent access creep and ensures that access controls remain relevant.
